intro: Smilax elegans subsp. glaucophylla, commonly known as the glaucophylla smilax, is a shrub-like plant native to the southeastern United States. It features compound leaves with spiny tips and produces small, yellowish-green flowers that develop into red berries. The plant is characterized by its stout, thorny stems and is often found in moist, wooded areas. Its foliage has a distinctive bluish-green hue, giving it its subspecies name. It is a member of the Smilacaceae family and is valued for its ornamental qualities and ecological role.
